website_summaries.verdict: A powerful unit with an appealing price.
pros: Does the work of an 18-volt unit in a more compact, 12-volt package
cons: no kit with extra batteries or accessories

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a handy tool.
customer_reviews.text: All my millwaukee tools are 18volt this being my first M12 product ever. So far it has been great very convienant, durable, and perfect in size for the house. And at less than the HD plus a battery is a super good deal. I'll definitely keep buying Milwaukee 12volt tools by how great this one is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this driver for taking truck dashes and such apart fuel to its smaller size...been using it for about a week now and am pretty impressed with the build quality feels rugged. One thing that did catch me off guard however was on this listing it says condition is new... after looking at it for a while found there was a big sticker on the top that read remanufactured in Mexico this is why I gave 4 out of 5 stars...remanufactured is not new....but you probably wouldn't be able to tell the difference
customer_reviews.author: nick g.

customer_reviews.title: Housing cracked after less than 8 hours of use
customer_reviews.text: The metal housing on the bottom portion of the nose cracked in under 8 hours of use. Was not misused or abused. Only used it to drive 1-5/8" deck screws while installing privacy fence. My return window with Amazon ran out 2 days ago
customer_reviews.author: Tony O

customer_reviews.title: On my side for every job.
customer_reviews.text: My original 2462 has never failed me for over three years using it on jobs ranging from convention setup/teardown to hotel renovations. I thought it took a walk on a recent job, and I immediately ordered another one to replace it. Luckily, I only misplaced it, so my older one has been retired to home use only, and the new one is now in my work bag. However, I don't know what kind of racket it is in which I simply get a tool shipped in a plastic bag in a plain box. No Milwaukee paperwork,box, or information whatsoever. Hmmm...
customer_reviews.author: Seneca Highlander

customer_reviews.title: More noise than torque.
customer_reviews.text: It really sounds impressive. It is so loud it must kick butt, right? Not so much. The first task I used this for was driving 3" screws into squeaky stair treads. It was seriously loud. But, it barely drove the screws in. This was even after drilling a pilot hole. I went back to my M12 series Milwaukee drill/driver. The regular drill did a better job. While I had to push harder on the drill than the impact driver, it was much faster. I started using it on drywall screws with a drywall bit. While annoyingly loud, it does this job well.
customer_reviews.author: Anomal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent torque impact.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Milwaukee impact driver I have purchased and I own many other brands of drivers. What I liked initially was the small compact size of this but worried it would have enough power. When I ordered the batteries (which I had to buy separately) and plugged one in, this tool became outstanding. Now it is my "go to" driver around my shop. Excellent torque and great balance in the hand while using. Its small, compact size make it perfect for my traveling bag whilst out in the field. Love the drill and will buy more than this one for my company.
customer_reviews.author: The Quintessential Man

customer_reviews.title: Lots of torque
customer_reviews.text: Use it daily. It will strip screw heads because it has so much torque. Best to use star or square drive screws. It's not a screwdriver to use in cabinet or furniture work because it is just too powerful. Better for construction work.
customer_reviews.author: staynavytom

customer_reviews.title: Very good impact driver.
customer_reviews.text: This impact driver works great. I got it for $44 which is an awesome price considering how much other Milwaukee 12V tools cost. I have a Milwaukee drill/driver that I’ve been using for about 10 years and I love it. This one appears to be just as good. This one is a dedicated tool for driving screws. It has a quick release chuck, and an impact mechanism automatically kicks in to help drive the screw. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: AV Sanch

customer_reviews.title: Lil Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Wow had it about 6 months its been my go to for driving Torx Wood screws 4" ......and self drill metal roof screws..Use it on auto repair..nuts and bolts ..it will (do and undo) most 3/4 /17mm and under size...it fits in small places ...Battery life almost unbelievable... appears to be smallest and will outdo most others.. I have three impact drivers all 1/4 Milwaukee/Ryobi/Dewalt so it aint my first rodeo..They all been good..The latter 2 will handle tuffer stuff but there twice the size...and twice the price so I give the Milwaukee a 5star+++ dan
customer_reviews.author: dan barosh

customer_reviews.title: Powerful 12 volt driver
customer_reviews.text: Light, and powerful, and last very long time if use high capacity XC 6.0 Li Ion battery. I use it for installing doors and driving screws and impacting small nuts and bolts. It's not as powerful as my 18 volt Porter Cable, but the size and weight makes for a very good compact driver. I
customer_reviews.author: Luna Tick

customer_reviews.title: it seems like it was quite a bit more power in reverse ...
customer_reviews.text: Handy for small jobs. Without actual measurements, it seems like it was quite a bit more power in reverse than forward. I did a little experiment with lug bolts on my car. It could remove most lug bolts on my car, but does much less to tighten them. I did not expect it to be powerful enough for car wheels, but I wanted to test it on something easy and safe. It was for the experiment only.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dittes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this drill. Was looking to upgrade from my Ryobi and bought this on sale. I am so pleased I did. Good power, not too heavy, but what is great is that it has a light attached so every time I touch the trigger it comes on. Depending on the time of day it really helps me with what I am doing. The other day I ended up working way past dusk and it was invaluable. If I didn’t have that feature I wouldn’t have finished the project. Very pleased with this purchase & the Milwaukee product line.
customer_reviews.author: NHCollegeKid

customer_reviews.title: Works but I don't like the collet
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to 1/4 hex collets that you have to push in to eject the bit, but for insertion, you just shove it in. This one is different. It's really a two handed operation. You have to depress the collet for both, and it doesn't eject. I really don't like it. Otherwise, its a solid tool that does the job. If I didn't have a better option, I wouldn't know better. :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott McAfoos

customer_reviews.title: Damn, son
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a simple but reliable impact, but holy crap. Batteries keep going like Johnny 5 at the end of Short Circuit 2. Screws can be reamed down till you give it about 5 uga dugga's, then the whole head of the screw gonna disappear off into the wood. It's said that these are what are going to power Tesla's new truck with it's mighty 300,000lb towing capacity. It's true witchcraft. Don't show the locals, they'll think there is a lot of copper in there.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and replaceable. Works well for the size. Slow but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Great lil impact. Battery life is dependent upon type of battery pack. I use a genuine 6ah battery. Don't cheap out on the battery b/c they won't last. Its a little loud when you use it to drive a handful of screws - so I start using my porta cable 20v drill. I have two of these drivers and love them. One for working on cars and the other one for working on and around house projects.
customer_reviews.author: MRCHIRO

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive hardworking impact driver.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a five year old model that had the switch go out. It is cheaper to buy new then replace switch. I love the drill, my Freind has the 18 volt model and laughs at mine, but mine is light weight and easy to handle on tall ladders and other awkward places. You must buy however at least the 2.5 amp battery. They drive a lot more screws.
customer_reviews.author: cncrestoration

customer_reviews.title: Trigger didn’t last a year
customer_reviews.text: Product was great when it worked. Though it didn’t even last a year before it started acting up. The trigger started sticking maybe 3-4 months in. So I would have lack of power (even with battery fully charged) at the 6-7 month mark. The trigger feels like it isn’t sliding all the way back (like if I’m only pulling half way) opened up to see if anything was preventing it from sliding. Nothing is in the way, looks like it’s something internal in the trigger mechanism. First Milwaukee product to fail me :( gun is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Harris

customer_reviews.title: This is great for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I already had a 20v impact, but wanted something smaller to keep in a drawer in my office to work on little things (mainly electronics/small wood projects, etc). I do not use it for screwing into studs/heavy impacting, but I wanted something with an impact that had a little more drive than a standard electric screw gun. This is amazing for my needs/expectations. The two downsides are the cost (was not wanting to spend quite this much) and the weight. It is still a little heavy compared to others. But well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: William R.

customer_reviews.title: I use this one every day and love the smoothness of the brush motor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the same time as my M12 kit that also included a brushless impact driver. I use this one every day and love the smoothness of the brush motor. I tried both in Home Depot and just didn't jive with the sound and feel of the brushless. I'm not saying its bad, just preference issue. One of my friends thats a mechanic at a dealership swore by this tool. He was right, so when his went south after being beat on for ten or so years I bought another one for him from this same seller. Excellent tool and price!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Better than my $500 snap on impact driver
customer_reviews.text: Auto mechanic here. Switching from snapon power tools to all milwalkee replacements and niche stuff snapon doesnt even offer. Everything else I bought is FUEL meaning its the better brushless version. This is not fuel I only bought this as a temporary replacement for my $500 snapon driver until I can afford the fuel m18 driver... all I have to say is wow. 3 times more powerful than the snapon, feels better in the hand (also better than a dewalt 20V MAX I have at home) and this is just the cheap non fuel M12 version. Blown awayq
customer_reviews.author: Kyles auto repair

customer_reviews.title: Well built impact driver
customer_reviews.text: Perfect impact driver for most things I build or repair. Has plenty of power for the #8 and #10 wood screws I mainly use, and also drives 1/4 inch gallons with ease. Looking forward to buying more M12 tools.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Potter

customer_reviews.title: Hardcore and Super Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm an "around the house" guy, but decided to build a shed and this thing is baller. It works great, is light, the battery lasts a while etc. Good value and really "drives them home". I don't think you can turn the hammer off, so if you're going into dry-wall, DON'T USE THIS. But for wood construction, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Brayack

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing daily. It rides around in the back of my work van. It takes out and installs lots of screws even works well on lag bolts going into wood. It's lightweight which is important because I use it all day long. It won't change the lug nuts on your car but it will take out any screw you need to remove.
customer_reviews.author: waynes

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: My company bought these exact tools for a project we did years ago. We used them 8 hours a day, 5 days a week and we used them like what they were: a tool we didn’t buy and wouldn’t have to pay to replace. These things are bullet proof. We literally used them as hammers, and I’m not kidding, to peck screwdrivers into plastic covers and get to the bolts we needed to take out. They never stopped working. Keep a fresh battery on deck and these things won’t fail. When it came time to buy one at home, it was a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Zane Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today & I'm happy with it. I work at a maintenance job & I think this will work great for what I need, although I will put it to the test. Seems genuine Milwaukee brand & made of good materials. The light above the trigger is actually brighter than I expected. The battery indicator & belt clip are a nice added feature. Shipping only took 24hrs & the price almost can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate. Great products
customer_reviews.text: This is now my 5th m12 tool. The 3/8 ratchet is so much more powerful than expected. The cut off tool is a huge surprise. Again powerful. The drill us great. And the soldering iron actually works. Now I'll have a small imoact to use along with them. Do yourself a favor and get the larger batteries. You'll understand once you have them.
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking to drive screws over an inch long, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the non-impact version of this Milwaukee for years and been very happy with it, so I figured the impact drive would be great. It's not. Makes an impressive amount of noise, but is very slow about actually getting any work done. Sent it back and will look for something with more torque.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: I was rebuilding my deck and had some Torx wood screws, 2 and 1.5 inches that my 18v Skill drill could not back out them out. I got this impact driver and went out in the rain to see if it could. And it worked like a charm. No problem at all. It did not even slow it down. It's now one of my favorite tools. I will buy another when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much nicer being a little lighter then the M18 impact
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price paid, use this impact as much as my M18 impact, not as punch punch , but performs all tasks without a problem. Great when hanging cabinets or doing overhead work.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman247 LLC

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee tools are great on my job or home
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these one at home and one at work, the one on the job is used everyday and saves a lot of time. The Milwaukee batteries last a long time between charges and with 3/8 drill i have can handle most project without breaking out the large drills with cords.
customer_reviews.author: chet

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical that...
customer_reviews.text: I use my impact almost every day. I was skeptical that this little thing could really stand up to my abuse. Now, it’s not an 18v”which I have as well “ but it really can rattle some screws or lags. Over all I’m happy with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Erik M. Armour

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love having this in my tool box it speeds so many under the hood or around the house jobs I've driven 3 1/2 inch deck screws though a 2x6 into a nother 2x6 just fine no problems and the biggest bolt I've loosened with it is 9/16 witch isn't bad for a 1/4in drive
customer_reviews.author: david h.

customer_reviews.title: Good for small screws/bolts
customer_reviews.text: The thing works great. There was a 10mm I needed to take off that had lock tight on the threads and it could not take it off which was kind of disappointing but most screws/bolts it will take off. Also tried a 1/2 lag screw 3” long into wood and it did that too. Update: I’ve used it for about 3 months now and it is still holding up great same power as the first day I used it and it can take a beating too!
customer_reviews.author: kyle mabe

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Has more torque than I expected. I usually use it to remove boat loads of screws, but have also used it to put in self tapping screws through metal backplates in electrical panels. Always has enough force to do it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great light duty tool
customer_reviews.text: Impact drivers have become so powerful that screws are stripping and shearing. This driver does the light work. It's not for driving a three inch deck screw or lag bolts. It's for removing access panels or driving tapcons into cement without stripping. Light weight and great for zips in tin duct.
customer_reviews.author: Electrician B692

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that would drill through metal studs and this worked perfectly. It’s loud as all hell but that’s to be expected with impact drivers. It’s lightweight and compact and I love it
customer_reviews.author: F. Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little impact
customer_reviews.text: I use this just about daily for work and it does a good job, I like the fact the nose on this impact is longer than on my other impact driver where it is short. It has held up well so far with out issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A tool from the gods.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite driver even with the advent of newer designs. These little beauties are durable and get the job done. Don’t be the knucklehead who tries to use them like a 3/8 impact gun and you’ll get years of life out of one. This tool is my most used tool daily and my last one lasted 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quick one day jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Love carrying the smaller M12 tools for short work. Not ready for torquing all day on 5/16" x 3" cement screws but easily handles an hour or so of heavy use on a fresh battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mur Man

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to use. I've been using it consistently in the shop and haven't had any problems with it. Small and light so fits in tight spaces and it's not tiring to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Marron

customer_reviews.title: Compact in size not ability.
customer_reviews.text: For jobs where you do not need as much torque or have a smaller space to work in, it is great. I actually use it more then the 20v Dewalt. The Dewalt is a great tool, but larger and more torque which some times is a problem. But but compact just works better for me in my work. Great tool and great line of tools.
customer_reviews.author: nomore

customer_reviews.title: Tough, fast, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough drill. I’m a commercial electrician and I use this everyday. I have dropped this on accident on numerous occasions from as little as a few feet to 10’ heigh on concrete and it keeps working. It spins fast enough to use with self-tapping screws on metal studs.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Love it for the price! It's a steal
customer_reviews.text: Milwaukee power tools are all great. The m12 small battery doesnt have a ton of life but that's not what were reviewing here. The tool is great for 1/4" drive stuff and anything else you'd use in a nut driver.
customer_reviews.author: richard s wilson

customer_reviews.title: excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: absolutely loved it. i have a milwaukee bit set as well and i redecorated and fitted my whole garage with this. making holes in studs and hard wood is so much easy. driving screws in studs and hard wood is also super easy.
customer_reviews.author: jimboyrulez

customer_reviews.title: M12 Impact driver is a beast.
customer_reviews.text: This impact is a beast for how compact it is. This is the brushed version of the m12 impact driver. Yet, I really like this tool. This driver was worth the $30 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: paul espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It has some decent power, is easy to use and feels right in my hand. I only wish it had power settings. However you can control how much power it’s putting down with how much trigger you are using.
customer_reviews.author: KatieLee

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: i like that it is light that little think strong ease to handle it is small i can take it any where its good so far i like it the light on it works good i think i might get me another one thank you
customer_reviews.author: harold n.trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Mini Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Fairly heavy in the hand, a bit noisy when the torque kicks in but one hell of a driver. Low profile, ergonomic, perfect for storage. Can't beat the price. The FUEL is obviously better but you pay a large premium, better off going with an 18v Makita LXT, depending upon your needs. For me, I travel with this bad boy so it's absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Soprano

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee has a quality impact driver.
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go-to item in my workshop and I use it for everything. I had previously purchased the drill so I had several batteries. Purchasing the impact drill which uses the same batteries as the drill only made sense and it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Get the 4 hour battery and don’t strip screws!
customer_reviews.text: Small but sturdy...has enough power to torque down 3.5” lag bolts into hard woods. Just slow it down if your a fool that uses em on doorknobs or things w/ cheap screws(ceiling fans,light fixtures,appliances, etc). Def strong enough to strip anything decorative. Just used it last week to drill through a snowblower wear bar, the snowblower metal, and 2 pieces of angle iron holding it all together!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Drains batteries faster than original
customer_reviews.text: Replacement product uses more battery than origional with brand new battery i get about 3 or 4 bolts tight then need to recharge battery
customer_reviews.author: Steven mangano

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: Some how misplaced my other unit bought this one I just love these without bulky battery at end of handle awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Michael T Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: These Milwaukee tools are the best on the market right now and buying bare bones makes sense when you see what you can get OEM batteries and chargers for.
customer_reviews.author: LouisFL

customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it was a legit Milwaukee drill seemed fakeish so i sold it an bought a snap on one
customer_reviews.author: James gallagher

customer_reviews.title: has used it daily and just love it. I use it more than the electric ...
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much with the negative reviews, but it worked flawless for my work. has used it daily and just love it . I use it more than the electric drill to install wood screws and small tapping screws
customer_reviews.author: Ron H

customer_reviews.title: perfect replacement, brand new
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace one I lost on a job, perfect replacement, brand new...I a huge Milwaukee fan so I'm bias. Lol .. but this thing is strong enough to handle just about anything, batteries last forever. Can't kill these Impacts. As a contractor mine gets used everyday.
customer_reviews.author: chris christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact drill, but getting the batteries out are painful for my fingers that I bite too short. You have to squeeze the battery in such a weird way to remove it, that it feels like you will break it.
customer_reviews.author: jd picchietti

customer_reviews.title: Great Impact Driver!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say this is awesome! Got it for 38 bucks as a bare tool and am so pleased with it, I feel like I got a super good bargain! I know there are newer versions available but as a DIYer it's all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kevlnda

customer_reviews.title: Less Price as pair through Amazon then buying as set ...
customer_reviews.text: Less Price as pair through Amazon then buying as set at HD. HD drill only is 149.00 w out batteries. I got two batteries plus drill for 69.00 total
customer_reviews.author: Mike Silva

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite happy with this purchase, it's an excellent little tool and very well built. You cannot beat the price for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Small package with great power!
customer_reviews.text: Love this impact driver!! Perfect for house projects! Redid my front porch with this thing and it had no problem driving hundreds of 3 inch decking screws!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wade

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this for 95% of the jobs around my house now that I used to use my larger impact for. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I mean for the cost, the time it saves is unreal. Not super strong but if you have a lot of bolts to remove, break them loose, then zip them out with thing in a blink of an eye.
customer_reviews.author: Micaiah E. Kidney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I especially used serval days before giving the feedback and I was quite satisfied about it. One for my little brother and one for myself. Both are working well. I was kinda worried about the quality before buying since it was too cheap and I cannot get this price in Home Depot; however, after getting the products I was quite happy as they are exactly as described from the seller. Good price!
customer_reviews.author: Mercer Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I dig this for the price. Not quite up to par with the fuel version but worth a hard look! I use it daily as a plumber hard to beat that price.
customer_reviews.author: Zac / Heather

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous torque. This says it all. Rugged, the battery life is excellent. I already had the same battery so I save just ordering the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rope Climber

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for a few days then lost power
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use every day and after a few days the unit lost power and is unusable, I have other tools in this line and they all perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple weeks of general home improvement and put this thing through its paces and it held up well. It is probably not a pro tool but I am very satisfied with this as homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: DavidWCheney

customer_reviews.title: You don't need those big cordless tools these do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Can be used as a driver or a drill. Great tool, I got it to use as a driver and then found that it can be a great drill. You need to get drills with the lock ends but you don't have to deal with the temperamental chuck any more. Think out side the box and get one.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Lee

customer_reviews.title: The right thing, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son for work, repair of household appliances, he is very pleased. Such a thing should be in every home!
customer_reviews.author: Yelena

customer_reviews.title: My tool guy isn't talking to me... :)
customer_reviews.text: Goes toe to toe all 15 rounds with the big tool truck guys.. and save some kaching...
customer_reviews.author: madchefscooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: Great driver nice size when doing smaller projects but it will drive a 3 in screw
customer_reviews.author: esbm308

customer_reviews.title: It's not what I really want though it was fuel 2553-22 that's what I was looking for.thank you
customer_reviews.text: I just got it's is morning haven't tried it yet but i need to return back for the one i reorder the Fuel 2553-22 ,12volt tool
customer_reviews.author: Rick F.

customer_reviews.title: Ships in a bag
customer_reviews.text: I like the tool and I like Milwaukee tools. Only reason for no five star is because it shipped in just a bag not the typical box that Milwaukee sells their tools in. Normally I wouldn’t care but this was a gift for my dads birthday so I wasn’t happy about this shipping package.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee quality
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you expect for a Milwaukee 12v. Lightweight and portable. Great for around the house or jobsite.
customer_reviews.author: macfb9

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for anything other than light home use
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for small home projects. Quality is not the best. This only come with the tool. No battery, no box...nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Marrone

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: KInda weak, but that's fine, as it is not gonna be moving anything crazy anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Bot

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Used as a replacement for my bigger m18 no regrets on using a smaller drill.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Betta

customer_reviews.title: The best. Simple as that.
customer_reviews.text: I use this 6 days a week, 10hrs a day for work. I would buy nothing else, period.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mikhailov

customer_reviews.title: Quality impact driver for HVAC applications
customer_reviews.text: I’m a HVAC service technician and use this impact for light service work such as removing 5/16 or 1/4 in door screws on air handlers and condensers. It has worked perfectly and is much lighter than my Milwaukee 18V impact. It has enough torque for anything I would put it through. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: It broke my nuts

customer_reviews.title: I needed a small drill and didn’t want to pay ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small drill and didn’t want to pay full price for a new one. I bought this in the wearhouse deals section. I have used it on several occasions without any issues.

customer_reviews.title: Nice driver.
customer_reviews.text: This was for an old battery and charger that I had. Spent half a day drilling into sheetrock and hanging shelves with no troubles. I have smaller hands so this fit my hand well with no fatigue. Plenty of power to drive sheetrock screws.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: My husband had one of these before and lost it. So he had to have another. He loves it

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I wish I had bought it sooner. Drive long screws without slipping off the screw. It’s noisy as it drives the screw but that’s because it’s an impact tool.
customer_reviews.author: s.m.

customer_reviews.title: Great, lightweight, not for deck screws
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional assembler. You pair this tool with a 6" bit extension, and the amount of propane grills one can assemble is only limited by the assembler!

customer_reviews.title: It is an m12 so not quite as strong as m18 but very good
customer_reviews.text: Like any other Milwaukee product works great I have an m18 as well and let me tell you this little m12 far exceeded my expectations would by again accept it’s a Milwaukee and will probably last forever

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this bare tool and by off brand batteries you have a drill that performs the same for a fraction of the cost... I use it everyday, I love how lightweight it is, would buy again

customer_reviews.text: Used for plumbing jobs. Screws, bolts, lags. Drills good use with larger battery for better results.

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 2462-20 M12 1/4 Inch Hex Shank 12 Volt Lithium Ion Cordless 2,500 RPM 1,000 Inch Pounds Impact Driver w/ LED Light and Fuel Gauge (Battery Not Included, Power Tool Only)
product_meta.description: Color:Original VersionImpact drivers are ideal for driving large fasteners like lag bolts through porches and other thick materials. With the Milwaukee M12 Impact Driver, you’ll be getting top-of-the-line performance in a compact package. You’ll be able to drive what you need while maintaining control with the greatest amount of comfort. Its rubber-molded pistol grip increases friction between the tool and your hand, enabling optimal handling in slippery conditions. Beyond the comfort, there are tons of features packed in here that make it a step above the competition. Most powerful of all is the unit’s motor. It can drive fasteners with up to 1,000 inch pounds of torque at 2,500 revolutions per minute. With such a lightweight unit, this is tremendous power. There are also internal electronics that allow cross-communication between the tool and whichever M12 Redlithium battery is powering it. This allows the tool to monitor itself for overheating, and it powers down before it can be damaged, a feature unheard of in other 12 volt impact drivers. Beyond that, you get LED lighting on the front to brighten your workspace, and an LED fuel gauge on the side to let you know how much work you can do on your charge. Wherever you work, with Milwaukee by your side, you’ll be getting the job done properly.
feature_bullets: LED LIGHTING: Keep your work subject illuminated with the trigger-activated LED light panel located above and in front of the trigger. Its location prevents any shadows from being cast by your trigger finger
ONBOARD FUEL GAUGE: LED lights on the side of the impact driver let you know, in increments of 25%, how much battery you have left
AMBIDEXTROUS BELT CLIP: Whether you’re right or left-handed, you can keep the included belt clip attached on the side of the driver that is most convenient for you

REDLITHIUM TECHNOLOGY: This driver has internal computer technology that communicates with RedLithium batteries powering it. It enables cross-communication between the two systems, keeping the tool’s motor from overheating or drawing more power than it can handle

M12 COMPATIBLE: This tool will function with the batteries in the Milwaukee M12 lineup. These include the 48-59-1201, 48-11-1970, 48-11-2401, 48-11-2430, 48-11-2460, 48-11-2420, 48-11-2402, and 48-11-2440

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,149 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
